pros: Daily Devotions, Great People, Structured Onboarding, Outstanding Benefits, Challenging and Rewarding Work, Well Equipped for Work
cons: I have not experienced any 'cons' significant enough to mention here.

pros: Health Insurance and Benefits are above standard and affordable. Mission-based organization.
cons: Weaponizes scripture for the purpose of manipulating employees. Lacks diversity among leadership personnel with no desire to adjust.

review_title: Not for those who want to advance their career
job_title: Mid Level Management in Nashville, TN
pros: Clings hard to their mission, great for those who want to know exactly what to do and how to do it. Benefits are good, but pay is low.
cons:
No opportunity for growth, especially for women.
Unclear goals and vision
Leadership is never on the same page
Lots of red tape to accomplish anything

review_title: Great Faith-Based Non-Profit in many respects
pros: There are many great employees at The Gideons and also we have some of the best members/volunteers you'll find anywhere. People with a strong faith and devotion to reaching the world with the gospel. A very solid health benefits package as well as 401K matching benefits.
cons: Salary growth is less than desirable, partly because of being a non-profit. Work-life balance is fairly good, however once in higher levels of leadership it appears that can be a challenge.

review_title: Great place to do work that makes a difference!
pros: Everyone is friendly. Management cares about you as a person. No micromanagement, given goals and tools and asked to participate. Meaningful work, kind generous people and bosses. I couldn't ask for more in a job. Oh yeah, no weekends, paid 30 minute devotions, onsite gym, 1 hour lunch, 7:30 am- 4:30 pm....
cons: If you need to be micromanaged this may not be the place for you. You are allowed to think and try to find the best solutions for issues when appropriate.

pros: I believe in their mission and am now a part of that. The people are wonderful and pleasant people. Great work environment. They offer great benefits. I love their work ethics / standards. They have a gym, cafeteria, little snack bar, security, devotions time, plenty of parking. They hold to high, Godly standards. Plenty of room for growth.
cons: So far I don't see any.

job_title: Customer Service Representative/Order Entry in Cross Plains, TN
pros: They are a great Christian company, that has a goal of spreading God's word around the world.
cons: I had a boss that did not like having older people in her group and was determined to have nothing but younger employees, that she could manipulate.

review_title: Fulfilling in every sense of the word.
pros: Serving the membership in a Christian Business and Professional Men's Association, in 12,000 locations world wide. Global access via MBO/NGO.
cons: DBA Global membership governance delivered "una  vox". May unnecessarily extend response time of initiatives and effective responses due to redundant protocols in place designed for self preservation. We are to evangelize the world not westernize it- Rev.Billy Kim

pros:
I worked for The Gideons almost ten years, as in any business, you have your ups and downs. You just have to keep focused on the idea "you're working for God" even though a man or woman is overseeing you. It might not be pleasant at times, but you do get past it.
I retired in July 2013 & miss all of the friends I had there.
cons: There can be a lot of stress there @ times, as in any job.

pros: Very good place to work. There is work/life balance and good employee benefits. Staff also has free coffee, tea and snacks. Employees can be cooperative except for a few that are unpredictable.
cons: Not much. Little or no opportunity for growth or career development.

review_title: If you like serving Him, this is an awesome place to be.
pros: The hours and location are great. Daily devotions to start your day out right.
cons: Upper management needs to be improved.

pros:
Work that has a global and eternal impact
A genuine sense of fulfillment at the end of the day
Talented staff 
Great culture
cons: 119 year old ministry - can be slow when making changes or necessary adjustments

pros: Worldwide Christian outreach providing far-reaching impact
cons: Salary limitations and somewhat limited opportunity for career growth

pros: Great work environment.  Very reasonable and understanding.  Worship service every morning.
christian's environment, benefits, managers' support, careers opportunities
cons: I don't have anything against this company

pros: Great environment. Great people, enjoyed working there.
cons: Had to travel extensively away from home

job_title: Financial Systems Analyst in Hendersonville, TN
